To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a special resource study of Fort Ontario in the State of New York.
Fort Ontario Study Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Mr. McClintock moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 46.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 115-110.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 147.

bill.summary:
Fort Ontario Study Act
(Sec. 3) This bill directs the Department of the Interior to conduct a special resource study of Fort Ontario in Oswego, New York.
Interior shall: (1) evaluate the Fort's national significance, and (2) determine the suitability and feasibility of designating it as a unit of the National Park System.
